places.adrFormatAddress: 12 Av. des Spélugues, 98000 Monaco

editorialSummary.text: Plush hotel featuring refined quarters, a posh restaurant & a spa, plus a champagne bar.

text.text:
My stay at this hotel was a bittersweet experience which leads me to share an honest review. Let's start with the positive aspects: the cleanliness of the hotel is truly impeccable. Every corner shone with neatness, which is worthy of praise:.
Special recognition deserves the breakfast as it offered a wide variety of options that would satisfy any palate. The quality of the food is excellent and is the highlight of this establishment.
However, the disappointing part of my visit was the interaction with the staff. Despite the high expectations I had for the quality of the hotel, the treatment by the employees was not up to par. I had the impression that only someone who arrives in a Ferrari or a Rolls Royce is worthy of exceptional kindness.
A hotel of this category should offer equally excellent treatment to all its guests, regardless of their mode of transportation. This was a negative point in my experience, as customer service should be a priority in any luxury establishment.
All in all, if you value cleanliness and high-quality food, this hotel has a lot to offer. However, if you expect friendly and attentive treatment from the staff, you may be disappointed, unless you arrive in a luxury vehicle.

text.text:
I had a wonderful stay at the Fairmont. They were very accommodating and sensitive to my needs. I went from the hospital to the hotel and the staff did everything in their power to make sure I was comfortable.

A big thank you to Jean Michell who really went the extra mile. I wasn’t able to leave my room due to my surgery and he was always so helpful and kind.

A big thank you.

Instead it's locked to very slow rate unless you pay for it.... nowadays that's just a bit silly! Stay there on business again? Sure, on my own dime? Probably not.

text.text: It is a great hotel, nice, clean, all details are taken care of, the people are kind and friendly. I had a small issue with the wifi and it was solved in 5 minutes. Very nice swimming pool (indoor/outdoor). Excellent breakfast. Great view!

originalText.text: It is a great hotel, nice, clean, all details are taken care of, the people are kind and friendly. I had a small issue with the wifi and it was solved in 5 minutes. Very nice swimming pool (indoor/outdoor). Excellent breakfast. Great view!

text.text:
Firstly, if you’re traveling with kids remember: Monaco is not kids-friendly zone. Everyone is smoking and there is zero smoke-free area around the pool. To the management of the hotel: consider to stand out and introduce the smoke-free zone for families with kids on one side of the pool. Passive smoking kills - proven by science. Why do you allow passive damage of kids health in your hotel?
The rooms have great view,  yet they def need renovation. Mattress are comfortable.
Food is phenomenal in all areas.
Coffee is very poor: 10 euros for cheap, over roasted espresso from automatic chimbally machine… 20 euros for iced coffee :) For management: hire coffee consultant and level up your coffee game with specialty beans. Then you have the right to charge higher price.
Cleaning stuff on the floor (#4) is super pleasant, efficient and friendly.
The location of the hotel is great. There are few great restaurants on the beach, 7min walking distance. I will recommend this hotel if you don’t care about the disgusting smoke of cigarettes.

text.text:
Great location and service is excellent all around.

The concierge arranged our airport transfer back to the Nice airport and the driver arrived 15 mins earlier. The car is excellent and our journey was so smooth.

Porters are very helpful and called the taxi for us throughout our stays in Monta Carlo.

Our room had a comfortable king sized bed and a balcony overlooking the view of the sea and garden area which was fantastic. Facilities are good enough for a 4 starred hotel and amenities are minimum. We cant complain much.

We were authorised with a late check out but still happily to pay extra to have our room till 6pm in the evening. Thank you for accommodating us.

Beautiful venue and the restaurant on the ground floor was good but it took them a few hours to bring up the champagne back to our room and the bottle went a bit flat.

Overall, we had an excellent stay here and thank you.

places.adrFormatAddress: 22 Av. Princesse Grâce, 98000 Monaco

editorialSummary.text: Polished property with modern rooms, a private beach & dining, plus indoor & outdoor pools.

text.text:
We booked our stay over Christmas at a very last minute but received the most amazing service throughout the booking procedure and the entire stay.
A BIG BRAVO TO THE TEAM; especially to Ina from Guest Relations and Antonio from the Concierge Service.
A hearty welcome, a much appreciated room upgrade and even the last minute ordered Christmas tree was set up in the room!
Bravo and Thank You all!
We asked for a natural Christmas tree and the Concierge & Team organized it. Not a very fresh tree but a beautiful bushy tree!
Throughout the stay we experienced a very welcoming service at the restaurants, reception and Concierge, brilliant and fast room service with amazingly tasting dishes, a super clean room, great maid service and a balcony with the best sea view!
We felt very welcome and will certainly come back soon!
THANK YOU!

places.adrFormatAddress: 16 Bd Princesse Charlotte, 98000 Monaco

editorialSummary.text: Bright rooms in a contemporary hotel offering an outdoor pool, plus an airy restaurant & a bar.

text.text: Immediately we had someone help us park as it is quite difficult in Monaco to even drive around! It was much appreciated! The counter staff were friendly and courteous. They helped us find interesting things to see as we were only staying for two nights. (Highly recommend getting on the "Hop on and Hop off bus" to get a quick tour of the city and wind up at the royal castle and grounds!) The workout facility was excellent. And then there was breakfast - WONDERFUL, with loads of variety! Great staff and bar staff in the restaurant as well. Even the maid service was friendly and a pleasure to speak to. Unfortunately, we stayed in the off season so we could not enjoy that lovely pool. We did get to view and take pictures of the garden and outdoor lounge and bar area which I am sure would be a lot of fun to hang around and wind down at.

text.text:
The best thing for me was the lost and found collection service after check-out. I left my power bank in the room, and even before I realised it I receved an email with a picture of the object to say if I wanted to collect or discard. I chose to collect it and the entire service was great and smooth. Loved the proactiveness and care of the hotel on this aspect. Thank you! The hotel and location are nice.
But I really don't like the bathroom/toilette split in the rooms. I don't understand what's the benefit of splitting like this, there is no washing hands on the same division of the sanitary...and that's where you need it.
The TV was not working.
Everything else was quite good.

text.text:
Overall a really good experience. Nice reception area with small independent reception desks, instead of one big formal counter. you can look downstairs from the lobby to the restaurant, bar and pool.
I enjoyed the sauna which is part of the gym area.
room was tidy and big. the smart tv connected well to my phone so i could watch Youtube videos. breakfast was good. i liked the selection of hot plant-based drinks at one of the coffee machines.
Flaws:
-a clear identification of all the breakfast stuff which is vegan would be very helpful.
- and more vegan dishes like vegan pancakes, cakes etc.  I ordered slippers at the reception which never were delivered to the room though, like promised
-the pool is too shallow at one end to properly swim.
- the changing room and shower of the gym was not tidy when i got there in the evening. more regular check-ups please

text.text:
We visit Monaco 2-3 times a year and have following the construction of this hotel and couldn't wait to be guests of this amazing building.
A perfect place with a high level of hospitality.
When we arrived, they greeted me flawlessly, opened the car door, were very kind, and even answered my child's phone without asking, which immediately fell under the car.
Congratulations on hiring and employing such nice colleagues who are extremely helpful.
The hotel is a beautiful, perfect place with its wonderful panorama for couples and families who want to relax.

text.text:
I had the privilege of staying at this remarkable hotel, and I am absolutely thrilled to share my experience. Everything about it was simply outstanding.

First and foremost, the view from my room was nothing short of breathtaking. I was treated to a panoramic vista that left me in awe every time I looked out. It was like having a front-row seat to the most picturesque scenery imaginable.

The room itself was the epitome of high-class luxury. Every detail had been meticulously thought out to provide the utmost comfort and sophistication. From the plush furnishings to the tasteful decor, it was clear that no expense had been spared to create a truly indulgent atmosphere.

However, what truly sets this hotel apart is its top-notch service. The staff went above and beyond to cater to my every need. Their attention to detail and genuine warmth made me feel like an honored guest throughout my stay.

We Stayed for two night at hotel and had a chance to book a Menu Gourmand at the restaurant  included breakfast.
Great welcoming from all the staff from vallet to reception and floor team.
Loved the belvedere from our room which by the way was so cosy .
Breakfast was fantastic with wide choices on the menu and lovely selection of small pastries from trays .
Menu Gourmand was quite focused on sea weed honestly however loved the chef was highlighting the sea food and fish perfectly yet so simple and well balanced .
Also the grand cru wine pairing was a mix between new world and old presented by enthusiastic sommelier.
Overall great experience.
Thanks.

places.adrFormatAddress: Sq. Beaumarchais, 98000 Monaco

editorialSummary.text: Elegant hotel with chic, Belle Epoque-style rooms & upscale dining, plus free Wi-Fi & spa access.

text.text: One of the best luxurious hotels in Monte Carlo. I can’t say enough how beautiful this hotel is. Everything was made and built to perfection. Pictures will not do justice. Conveniently located right in the heart of Monte Carlo where everything is pretty much walking distance, from nice little cafes to high end shopping stores. I wanted to try the spa unfortunately it was closed for some renovations. Regardless, I still had one of the best experiences here in this beautiful city at the Hermitage Hotel. Staff are friendly and not to mention beautiful, everyone was dressed so well and so kind, always smiling. The hotel is beautifully decorated with fresh flowers and mostly orchids everywhere. The breakfast are is breathtaking. The view is incomparable to anywhere I’ve been to. You could also easily walk to the Monte Carlo casino which is also another place that’s a must visit for its grand and magnificent view inside.

The breakfast are is breathtaking. The view is incomparable to anywhere I’ve been to. You could also easily walk to the Monte Carlo casino which is also another place that’s a must visit for its grand and magnificent view inside.

text.text:
Well, just like everything else in Monaco, this place is 5 stars all the way!
We were given an amazing gift bag at check-in that just made my head almost pop off! The rooms are decorated for royalty, and the service here is second to none. This has got to be in my top 2 hotel stays in the world.
Thanks for an unforgettable experience!

text.text: We weren't sure where to stay in Monaco as we had never been to the area, but after looking into options and reading the great reviews we opted for Hotel Hermitage. We could not have been more pleased. The hotel is absolutely stunning - with its breathtaking architecture and opulent decor. Our room was spacious, comfortable, elegant, and remarkably quiet. The bathroom was beautiful, clean, and well-appointed. The lovely patio was a wonderful place to relax on chaise lounges. The location is perfect as we were steps away from the famous Monte Carlo casino, tons of shopping and eating options, and the beautiful marina with all of the yachts. I used the spa, which was quite busy but beautiful and modern. We also ate at the Michelin-starred restaurant Pavyllon and had one of the best meals we have had in recent years with perhaps the best views we have ever had at a restaurant. I highly recommend the hotel!

editorialSummary.text: Bright rooms & suites in a casual hotel offering an outdoor pool, a gym & a restaurant with a bar.

text.text:

text.text:
The hotel is located near the port and beach.
Rooms are a bit old, but are clean and spacious. The balconies are very big.
The reception stuff is very kind and nice.
Breakfasts are rich in choice (a lot of fruits, peanuts, salty dishes, cheeses etc).
The hotel also offers free bikes and shuttle to some stops in Monaco (like Casino or tram station), which is very convenient.
Overall, we enjoyed our stay a lot and would love to come back!

text.text:
We stayed for 6 nights and were mainly comfortable. I would not consider the hotel 4*. It is 3.5* at best. It is incredibly dated, the pool is shown on pictures to be bigger than it really is. There was mould in the room around A/C. The rooms themselves are very old as highlighted in other reviews. The bedding wasn't changed once during our stay. We had a Mountain View room that backed onto a community football pitch which was quite noisy. Additionally the doors slam and lots of people are not considerate. It was common during our stay to be woken up between 2am and 3am by people slamming their doors. The breakfast is good and plenty of options.

Transport in Monaco is awful, it's next to impossible to get a taxi, Uber doesn't operate here. The hotel taxi was useful but one of the times the driver (DJ) asked us where his tip was, which we found to be very rude. (it's a complimentary service).

Overall, this stay and experience didn't live up to our expectations of a 4* nor that of a Marriott. We wouldn't stay here again nor recommend it.

text.text: My sister & I stayed here for 3 nights in July 2023 and had a wonderful experience!  The room was nice & modern and we had a balcony that looked out over the sea.  We had excellent service from the front desk, concierge (who helped us book a beach day a short walk away), shuttle drivers, breakfast staff, and luggage handlers.  The shuttle can drop you off anywhere downtown (casino, train station, palace) and you can easily cab or walk back, depending on distance.  We will definitely recommend this property to any of our friends who are planning to visit Monaco!

displayName.text: Hôtel Château de La Chèvre d’Or

editorialSummary.text: Refined hotel offering sea views, 3 restaurants & a bar, plus an outdoor pool & a spa.

text.text: Great location and friendly staff. It is disappointing that the room service menu is very poor and not updated to reflect what is actually available and especially what is available from 10pm, which is more like what you get in a 3 star hotel. This is in stark contrast to what they offer in the restaurants at the same time ( one of them has 2 Michelin Stars). The larger expensive suites are probably not occupied a lot as there is a stale water smell in the bathroom. The one you get when pipes are not run enough. When I asked to speak to a manager I was told here was nobody available and they had gone home...I had to email the CEO and even then nothing was resolved I was just told he would talk to me in the morning (when I will have likely left) . I would say a perfect dreamy place to stay in a normal room or basic suite so long as you don't expect too much food veriety on the room service menu and enjoy the restaurants instead. The mini bar is lacking in typical drinks and snacks you would expect in a top end 5 star hotel and they should leave more water in the suite each day. The massage treatments we had were great although we had to walk through a busy restaurant to go to and from the treatment rooms which is not ideal. I will day the room service server was very quick and attentive (albeit not empowered to offer anything outside the incorrect menu) but very good guy all the same. The front desk and bell boys gave quick and friendly service. In summary. they need to fix the small details to be able to justify the very expensive cost of the larger suites and compete with other properties near by. The location, staff and other amenities go a long way to making up for some of the defects though.

text.text:
My husband and I stayed at the hotel in the second week of October for three nights, and it was one of the best experiences of our lives. From the greetings, to the room and the entire poetic atmosphere of the hotel, we are counting the days to go back soon.
Special gratitude to the concierge that helped us with every little detail throughout our stay.

text.text:
We went to the Cafe du Jardin restaurant within the hotel which has an absolutely stunning view. The vibe here is nice and relaxed. They have a small menu, mainly pizzas. The pizzas were delicious. We were very impressed with the octopus and artichoke one. Good service and nice cocktails.

This restaurant is the more casual and budget friendly option as the other restaurants in the hotel are very expensive. But it was still an amazing experience with great food and a truly magical view.

text.text: Top hotel experience with great amenities, views and bus links to the rest of Monaco. Great breakfast and pastries. Rooms were clean, beds were comfy and staff were very accommodating. Pool did feel heated too which was nice. What more is there to ask for! Would definitely come back here again.

text.text:
The Columbus is excellent!  It is elegant and modern, with all the niceties of a modern hotel.  The concierge is ready to help at the drop of a hat and made us two bookings and got us a taxi within the first 2 hours after we arrived.  The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are pretty spacious, the showers are delightful, and my wife is very very happy which counts for a lot!!

I picked it because the price was right and it wasn't too far from the marina in Monte Carlo. It does require a taxi ride but the neighborhood is quiet by comparison with downtown and still very scenic.

editorialSummary.text: Luxe, individually decorated quarters, plus a gourmet restaurant with sea views & terraces.

text.text: Our stay at Chateau Eze was spectacular. The attention to detail that the staff pays to its guests is a measure by which we have used for all other hotels we have stayed at, and they all fall short! The very first night, our flight was extremely delayed, but the front desk staff waited until we got there at 10 pm to show us our GORGEOUS room, a romantic spread for our honeymoon, and even found some food for us because we hadn’t eaten all day! The hotel itself is nestled into this beautiful town, our room was indistinguishable from the landscape and cliff side into the beautiful harbor. It was incredibly private and so romantic! Every time we left and returned from our room, the front desk staff was so cheerful and thoughtful. They had excellent recommendations, they knew when we were leaving so cleaning staff could come in, and were so genuinely nice. I can’t wait to come back to this place again. Truly a 7 star experience.

editorialSummary.text: Sophisticated luxury hotel featuring a spa, an outdoor pool & a private beach, plus restaurants.

text.text: We were in this hotel a while ago. It’s really a great one! I loved the breakfast with such an amazing sea view! It was so relaxing! For a breakfast you have a great choice of fresh products. We decided to get a dinner there as well! And we do not regret! It was really great choice! If you are looking for a hotel with great view… amazing surroundings I would recommend this one!

originalText.text: We were in this hotel a while ago. It’s really a great one! I loved the breakfast with such an amazing sea view! It was so relaxing! For a breakfast you have a great choice of fresh products. We decided to get a dinner there as well! And we do not regret! It was really great choice! If you are looking for a hotel with great view… amazing surroundings I would recommend this one!

text.text:
We received our first room on time (3 pm) and the second room at around 5 pm as the previous tenant had a guaranteed late check out at 4. But the reception staff Nicholas was nice to offer us an upgrade for one of the rooms. It was slightly more spacious than the  original one.
Rooms are a bit dated and in my opinion don’t live up to the nightly price level.
Breakfast buffet while relatively small was amazing with high quality items. Service was great as expected.
The swimming pool is nice, clean and classy with great service too.
A major disappointment was the beach. The only good thing about it is the view of sea and hills in the background, otherwise the water is among the most unclean I have ever seen in the French Riviera. The water is full of leaves, candy wrappers, paper, other objects…
There is a boat with huge nets trying to keep it clean but the water condition is surprisingly still not acceptable. The neighboring public beach offers a better swimming experience!!

On checkout, we asked for a late checkout but we were offered an extra hour only for one of the rooms despite our late check in…

Finally, the concierge desk was very helpful with advice and booking events.
All in all, a good stay if you want luxury dining and a nice pool experience but if you are looking for a good beach or a luxurious room then you may be disappointed.

text.text:
Very welcome-looking personnel  at the reception. Very nice restaurant Jasmin with excellent service. Clean rooms. Private beach…
But:
1.	Housekeeping(( They do not see any problem if your room is not made until 4 pm! Even if the plate are on the door from 11. You have to contact them and discuss time of room cleaning if you want to be sure that the room are made before 4 pm.
2.	Beach is really small and when its full you are almost touching your neighbors
3.	It is not easy to adjust required water temperature from the shower tap. We had two rooms in two different buildings, but both have the problem.
4.	Should be very careful with the room selection. Railway and roads are very near. And if you are looking for really quite place - it is not about. Honestly speaking, if you room is not railway view, you can hardly hear  the train. But  outside the room you will definitely feel yourself as in in-city hotel.
5.	Unfortunately they did not use neither a/c nor fans for at the restaurants during our stay, and when it was hot outside and terraces were full it was a real challenge to have breakfast or lunch inside…
6.	There are neither coffee machine nor kettle in the room by default. They are by request. Be prepared that tea and coffee they will not add to your basket every room cleaning. You have to ask house keeping and probably remind them after.
7.	Be careful if you choose Orange Mansion when it’s rainy. On out last night we wake up from the water noise and found out that the water was coming to our room from the corridor. Nobody came to help or offer another room. So we dried our room by ourselves.  Again they did not see big problem, we did not get any apologies for “inconvenience”…

Hope you will not meet all of these points once you will be charming by Cote D’Azur and if you stay one or two nights. But for longer stay I would not recommend this hotel - too many issues(((

2.	Beach is really small and when its full you are almost touching your neighbors
3.	It is not easy to adjust required water temperature from the shower tap. We had two rooms in two different buildings, but both have the problem.
4.	Should be very careful with the room selection. Railway and roads are very near. And if you are looking for really quite place - it is not about. Honestly speaking, if you room is not railway view, you can hardly hear  the train. But  outside the room you will definitely feel yourself as in in-city hotel.
5.	Unfortunately they did not use neither a/c nor fans for at the restaurants during our stay, and when it was hot outside and terraces were full it was a real challenge to have breakfast or lunch inside…
6.	There are neither coffee machine nor kettle in the room by default. They are by request. Be prepared that tea and coffee they will not add to your basket every room cleaning. You have to ask house keeping and probably remind them after.
7.	Be careful if you choose Orange Mansion when it’s rainy. On out last night we wake up from the water noise and found out that the water was coming to our room from the corridor. Nobody came to help or offer another room. So we dried our room by ourselves.  Again they did not see big problem, we did not get any apologies for “inconvenience”…

Hope you will not meet all of these points once you will be charming by Cote D’Azur and if you stay one or two nights. But for longer stay I would not recommend this hotel - too many issues(((

text.text:
This is an absolutely wonderful luxury hotel, among the nicest I have ever visited. Top notch service from the staff and a beautiful, well kept property. The breakfast was amazing with lots of local products, cheeses, an omelet station etc. Onsite food & drinks are expensive, but it matches the hotel quality and setting; in any case, there are many other food options within a short walk, in Beaulieu-sur-Mer, which also includes a train station from where you can quickly reach Nice or Monaco.

I recommend any visitors also take a walk or short drive to visit the Villa Ephrussi de Rothschild and its amazing gardens.

editorialSummary.text: Elegant rooms & suites, plus upscale restaurants, in an 1886 hotel with a luxe spa & outdoor pool.

text.text:
The hotel is located in front of casino,
Great architecture, lovely decor,
but it’s totally gloomy inside, rooms are old and musty. Furniture and other equipment are fragile.
Breakfast is good, but dinner was not a great experience: uncomfortable chairs, low tables, strange.
But we love Monte-Carlo!
Service also could be better.

text.text: I think this hotel is magnifique!  I stayed here by accident and I was so happy I found it.  Stefan, Jorges and Arian were extremely helpful.  Stefan spoke English so that was a huge help. Jorges helped me order a souffle.  Arian in the business center helped me book Easyjet.  Besides all the services, this hotel is just beautiful!  For me, I think the rooms are very dressy.  I loved my room.  I wish they carried the sport channels.  I wanted to watch the US Open tennis, men only.  In fact there ARE NOT any sports bars in Italy, Monaco or Spain.  The lobby and pool are so attractive, I felt rich in this hotel. The location is perfect.  A few steps to the casino, Le Grill and Hotel du Paris where I found live music.  Shopping mall is right next to the hotel.  Breakfast buffet was included and it was delicious.  I ordered an egg white vegetable omelet.  They served fresh fruit.  The staff friendly and there to provide service. I wish I could stay there more often; unfortunately I am in Texas.  I definitely recommend staying here.  I miss Hotel Metropole!  It was worth every euro.

editorialSummary.text: Airy accommodations with private balconies & sea views in an elegant hotel offering a pool & a spa.

text.text:
I went for a spa day, lunch and massage.
I really enjoyed the spa. For the massage, Emilie was wonderful. I came in with neck muscle spasms and shoulder issues and her technique and deep tissue massage made all the difference. This is my first time in Terrasses d’Eze. Very clean establishment and excellent service.
I really appreciated the attention to detail of Emilie when adjusting different body parts and stretching or massaging as needed, and in a way that can actually help your pain points feel better. Compared to a massage done previously, my experience here seemed much more therapeutic and would provide lasting results for the next few days. I highly recommend and will definitely come back!

editorialSummary.text: Relaxed lodging offering laid-back studio, 1- & 2-bedroom apartments with kitchens.

text.text:
Stayed here for a few days on the 5th of December and couldn't have asked for a better experience. Everything about the hotel all the way down to how its run and its location was perfect! The staff were very friendly on arrival (didn't get the receptionists name at the time) and checked us in promptly. The rooms were very spacious and clean with clear instructions on how to operate the facilities throughout.

We stayed in room 107 which is a 6 person room and we couldn't of asked for anything better! Plenty of spacious beds that were extremely comfortable, a comfortable sofa bed and much more available throughout the apartment.

The location of the hotel was extremely convenient for us and anyone here to visit Monaco. its a 10-15 min walk to the harbor of Monaco but be warned, the climb back up can be very steep! There are luckily elevators that take you up street levels if stairs are a problem for you.

This hotel is a 10/10 on every scale, really enjoyed our stay and we will 100% be returning if we are ever in the area!

text.text:
Hi team,

I had booked my stay for 28 nights and when there was a change in plans, I went to the reception and asked if there would be any charges if I checked out after 21 nights. The reception clearly said there would be no charges if I informed them 4 days in advance and so I informed then 7 days in advance. But when I actually got my invoice, they had increased the room rate significantly for the last week and the refund I received was only 430 EUR where I expected 7 days rate refund coming to around 1200 EUR (166 EUR * 7 nights). My colleagues who did the same process received a refund of 700+ euros and 1200 + euros respectively since they booked through agencies who were able to negotiate better refunds. I had booked online. So for my booking was more profitable for the hotel since they paid no commissions, but I was not given the refund promised. I have upcoming stays in Monaco in October and I have chosen a different hotel for all this stay due to this experience. My company is also unhappy that I ended up paying more than my daily eligibility without their approvals.

editorialSummary.text: Modest hillside campground with ocean views offering tent & caravan sites, plus cabin rentals.

text.text: This is a nice campsite with great views, very clean amenities and friendly staff. However there are some issues! First is that there are only a small number of showers and toilets for a site of this size. Secondly these facilities and the site generally is looking very tired and needs a significant overhaul. Finally the price is way too high for the quality of the amenities here. We have stayed in places half this price that are better serviced. The route in is challenging which ever way you choose - best avoided if you have a large van. Steps up and down to town do make you very fit! Access to the train station is great for visiting other towns and Menton is lovely.

text.text: Friendly staff. Nice camping spots woth some shade, but there are gravel and hard pressed soil instead of grass = more ants around and inside the tent. VERY expensive compared to other campings here, 47 Euro for one night 2 adults, 2 kids and a tent, without electricity. The gates closes at 10 pm, so after that you can't access your camping spot with car. Only 2 toilettes for the whole camping, but they are clean. No paper on the toilettes "due to covid restrictions", still. The dish wash sink gives only burning hot water (2 seconds, then you have to press the button again) and you can't lower the temperature. Unfortunately no other campings around.

text.text:
Difficult to access the site, even using the recommended route. Views are spectacular but very difficult to access the town, and coming back up 300+ steps is not for the faint hearted. 2 sets of sanitaires we were closest to the more updated block, but it was something of a trek, especially if you need to go to the loo during the night. Decent restaurant next door to the site for meat eaters, but no fish or vegetarian options.
Not the worst site, but I wouldn’t be rushing back especially at these prices.

text.text:
We absolutely loved this campsite!
The drive up through town was a little hair raising, so try and come around the back way if you have a bigger camper. If you come through Menton there is a few hair pin turns on a steep slope.

On arrival and for the whole stay the staff were very helpful and friendly! We were given a full intro to the camp, what was where, how to order breakfast and get into town. The showers and toilet were clean and comfortable. The views are amazing and it’s pure tranquility up there!

It’s around 10 mins walk from Menton back up to the campsite up steep steps so keep this in mind.

Our favorite campsite along the Rivera!

P.s the pizzeria next to the campsite is absolutely amazing for views and pizza! A real hidden gem! Staff lovely here too!

text.text:

The toilets and showers were clean and you also had access to warm and drinkable water. There was a small group tent where you were able to charge your phone, sit together with others or watch TV. The Camping Spots are large and you had a lot of space to park and eat outside.
You have many of abilities to visit several places in under 40min. All in all we felt comfortable and would visit again!

We had previously stayed at Palaise Josephine when it was owned by another company and had good stays there.

text.text: The room smelled funny. Also, the AC wasn't cooling at all. Which is unacceptable at this price point. For nearly 200 a night, it should be cooling. The lady at the front desk was very rude and not helpful at all. Not a pleasant experience. Wouldn't recommend unfortunately.

text.text:
I asked if they had a room for next day. They insisted on making a booking for the room and told me I would not be charged if I did not show up. I cancelled the room just to be sure, but later I see that they charged me anyway. I complained to the manager who just claimed that I should have cancelled it. Which I did! despite that they did not require a cancelation in the first place.

I disputed the charge at my bank and the hotel tried to fight me with lies but I eventually got my money back. Do not let the reception make a booking for you! You have no control over it.

editorialSummary.text: Chic rooms & suites in a high-end hotel with 4 restaurants, a spa & a private beach.

text.text:
A lot of activities are available at the Monte-Carlo Beach club.
Personally, I think this place is amazing to have fun and spend beach days with family and friends.
But I also believe the sea quality is lower than other beautiful places available not that far from there.
The pool is super big and allows you to enjoy a lot of activities, which compensate the low quality of the sea and actual beach.
Of course this place has Monaco prizes, but if money is not a problem for you, feel free to go there.

displayName.text: Appart'hôtel Odalys City Les Hauts de la Principauté

editorialSummary.text: Modern units with kitchenettes in a relaxed apartment hotel offering sea views & a rooftop terrace.

text.text:
This hotel is  a nightmare hotel very dirty, the bathrooms have years of uncleaned lime soap traces in the shower as well as mould. I have never seen a place more filthy than this. Authorities should close it down and force the owners of this hotel to clean and renovate it because it is a health hazard!!! The room curtains are dirty, as well as the bed-skirt which has visible traces of black oily dirt accumulated in years and years of not being cleaned!!! The windows are not soundproofed so you can hear all the noises from the street, like heavy traffic and lots of motorcycles passing by day and night. The bed is very low and with an uncomfortable sponge mattress that gives you back pain. The hotel has a bad vinegar smell, it's something I've never experienced anywhere before.
The air vents for heating are not cleaned, you can see the dust inside and are very noisy. The toilet was broken and nobody came to fix it. The manager and the employees (all Italians) they simply mock the clients! They make comments in Italian behind the customer's back - it happened to me when I went to tell them about the dirty room. "If she doesn't like it, she should go to a 5* hotel" was one comment made by the manager, an Italian woman, as was right in front of them. A guy at the reception, Mario I think, told me that the rooms were clean, and "it's just like at home" , meaning the mould in the bathroom!
All the positive reviews for this hotel are fake, paid for, so be very careful because you will have a very unpleasant surprise when you get there. Please notice the response from the hotel to our posts, it promises to take care of the issues, but it NEVER does! Someone should call the French authorities to inspect and close down this place because it is a health hazard!

text.text:
NEVER GO TO THIS HOTEL!
My girlfriend's ID was stolen. She presented it to check in and they never returned it. Then the next day my girlfriend realized that she didn't have it and when we called the security she said that he had it so we should call the next day so they could send it to us. We called the other morning and the ID was no longer there! They treated us badly, they yelled at us and never wanted to help us! WORST HOTEL AND SERVICE OF MY LIFE

text.text:
I am staying here right now. Day 4 of a 12 night stay. I’m here for work.

My room has a putrid sewage stench coming from the piping work out of the sink and the shower. I have complained about it every single day they have said they’ve sent a technician.

Every single day when I get back from work, the stench is so shocking that I have to go to brush my teeth in one of my colleagues rooms. I didn’t even shower today because of the stench. They tell me there’s no room they can move me to. They said they’ve never had this problem before. But My friend who is staying two floors down from me in the exact same room, says they have a similar smell but not as bad as mine.

I’m absolutely horrified that this has not been sorted out. It is the most abysmal disgusting putrid vomit inducing stench I’ve ever had to endure. Yet again I’m sleeping with the windows open, getting eaten alive by mosquitoes, just in the hope that the smell will dissipate slightly.

I’m so so tired and disgusted. SORT IT OUT.
